abstract_summ: Based on the results, we report that stilbene based compounds in general and resveratrol, in particular, can be promising anti-COVID-19 drug candidates acting through disruption of the spike protein.Therefore, to find novel compounds against COVID-19, we created a library of 412 lichen compounds and subjected to virtual screening against the SARS-CoV-2 Main protease (Mpro).The structure files of Indian spices chemical compounds were taken from PubChem database or Zinc database and screened by molecular docking, by using AutoDock-4.2, MGLTools-1.5.6, Raccoon virtual screening tools.Thus, there is an urgent need of effective drug molecules to fight against COVID-19.Communicated by Ramaswamy H. SarmaABSTRACT: The outbreak of SARS-CoV-2 and deaths caused by it all over the world have imposed great concern on the scientific community to develop potential drugs to combat Coronavirus disease-19 (COVID-19).
title_summ: Stilbene-based Natural Compounds as Promising Drug Candidates against COVID-19.In Silico Screening of Some Naturally Occurring Bioactive Compounds Predicts Potential Inhibitors against SARS-COV-2 (COVID-19) ProteaseScreening and druggability analysis of some plant metabolites against SARS-CoV-2: An integrative computational approachAndrographolide as a potential inhibitor of SARS-CoV-2 main protease: an in silico approachStructure-based screening of novel lichen compounds against SARS Coronavirus main protease (Mpro) as potentials inhibitors of COVID-19Identification of new anti-nCoV drug chemical compounds from Indian spices exploiting SARS-CoV-2 main protease as targetIdentification of bioactive molecules from tea plant as SARS-CoV-2 main protease inhibitorsEvaluation of green tea polyphenols as novel corona virus (SARS CoV-2) main protease (Mpro) inhibitors – an in silico docking and molecular dynamics simulation studyIdentification of phytochemical inhibitors against main protease of COVID-19 using molecular modeling approaches
title_abstract_phrases: Therefore, to find novel compounds against COVID-19, we created a library of 412 lichen compounds and subjected to virtual screening against the SARS-CoV-2 Main protease (Mpro).Communicated by Ramaswamy H. SarmaStructure-based screening of novel lichen compounds against SARS Coronavirus main protease (Mpro) as potentials inhibitors of COVID-19ABSTRACT: The outbreak of SARS-CoV-2 and deaths caused by it all over the world have imposed great concern on the scientific community to develop potential drugs to combat Coronavirus disease-19 (COVID-19).Based on the results, we report that stilbene based compounds in general and resveratrol, in particular, can be promising anti-COVID-19 drug candidates acting through disruption of the spike protein.The novel coronavirus main protease (SARS-CoV-2 Mpro) play a crucial role during the disease propagation, and hence SARS-CoV-2 Mpro represents as a drug target for the drug discovery.Thus, there is an urgent need of effective drug molecules to fight against COVID-19.
